answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Daniel, 
This article talks briefly about the City of Hays, KS and their new program.
http://icma.org/en/icma/newsroom/highlights/Article/101577/More_Governments_Moving_to_Integrated_Paid_Time_Off
And here’s a little more on Hays:
http://icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/302343
Here is an e.bulletin from PHCC about benefits programs:
http://icma.org/Documents/QuestionAnswer/Document/7517
This City of Clearwater manual talks about short- and long-term disability in relation to paid time off.
http://icma.org/Documents/QuestionAnswer/Document/7369
I hope this helps. please let us know if need more information.
Thank you,
Max Moline
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: Daniel Guild
text: I am interested in looking at policies from local government agencies with a combination of Paid Time Off, short-term disability, and long-term disability programs working in cooperation with each other. Could you please share/email me your experience, who your insurance providers are, and a copy of your governing policy documents in Word? Thank you all for your help and consideration.
title: Paid Time Off and Fringe Benefit Program Design
